info.name: Infrastructure_AIBlock
info.description:
The AIBlock API allows you to interact with the AIBlock chain without the need for complicated, risky smart contracts. It's here to let you work with A-Block in a way that's fast, simple and secure.

#### Usefull links

- [AIBlock Developer website ](https://aiblock.dev/) & [](https://aiblock.dev/)[API documentation](https://aiblock.dev/docs/api/overview)
    
- [AIBlock Official website](https://aiblock.ch/)
    
- [AIBlock Github](https://github.com/AIBlockOfficial)
    
- [AIBlock Discord](https://discord.com/invite/dDgabkJMEG)
    
- [AIBlock Linktree](https://linktr.ee/ai3lock)
    

#### Contact

[byron.houwens@a-block.ch](https://mailto:byron.houwens@a-block.ch)

[robin.plojoux@a-block.net](https://mailto:robin.plojoux@a-block.net)

#### License

[GPL-3.0](https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.en.html)

item.name: Mempool

request.description: Get general information about the current node.
Get general information about the current node.
Get general information about the current node.
Fetches the balance/s for 1 or more addresses.

Create new transaction/s, which will be submitted to the Mempool nodes for inclusion into a new block. This call assumes a full transaction as part of the request body, which might make raw calls difficult to manage. For convenience, it may be best to use an A-Block library or SDK that abstracts this call for you.

item.description: The Mempool node is a special type of node responsible for collecting transactions and bundling them into new blocks. They also partition the mining network for mining and validate the blocks that these partitions mine. _There are only a limited number of Mempool nodes._

item.name: Storage

request.description: Get general information about the current node.
Get the latest block successfully mined and stored on this Storage node.
Fetches block/s from the chain by block number. Multiple block numbers can be supplied in the same request body.
Fetches a block or transaction from the chain.

response.name: 200_transaction

item.description: The Storage node is responsible for storing the full blockchain history. Once blocks are mined by the miners and sent to the Mempool nodes for validation, they are pushed on to the Storage nodes for long-term storage. Anybody is allowed to request a full history of the blockchain from the Storage nodes, but they are not required to keep such a history to participate in the network. _There are only a limited number of Storage nodes_.

item.name: Miner

request.description: Get general information about the current node.
Get wallet information about current miner wallet.
Export list of miner wallet keypairs.
Make payment from miner wallet to address.

item.description: The Miner node is most like the Bitcoin miner you may be familiar with. They are responsible for mining new blocks that they receive from the Mempool nodes and collect the associated block reward for their efforts. They are only able to mine a block if they manage to get into the partition for that round. _There can be an unlimited number of Miner nodes_.
